availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Maryland on June 13, 1830. Listed as a farmer in 1850. During the war, Schoolfield was a First Lieutenant in Williams Battery, Kentucky Artillery. Died no November 11, 1913 in Clay County, Illinois.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "John James Schoolfield (June 13, 1830 - November 11, 1913)," Memorial #31780459, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=SCHO&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=16&GScntry=4&GSsr=3721&GRid=31780459& (accessed June 26, 2017); National Archives and Records Administration (NARA); Carded Records Showing Military Service of Soldiers Who Fought in Confederate Organizations, compiled 1903 - 1927, documenting the period 1861 - 1865; Catalog ID: 586957; Record Group 109; Roll 136; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Braacken County, p. 16; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Brooksville, p. 145.
